<small>Hebrew form: [[H3426]]</small>
 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִיתַי‎</span> ([[BDB#Baer|Baer]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִתַי‎</span>, except before suffix, see [[BDB#Baer|Baer]]<sup>[[Dan.2.10|Dan 2:10]]</sup>) **particle** ==there is, are. . .== (properly a **substantive** following by a genitive, see Biblical Hebrew  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יֵשׁ‎</span>: Egyptian Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎איתי‎</span> RÉS<sup>361</sup>, [[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup>Pap.</sup>, Nabataean <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎איתי‎</span>, Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אית‎</span>, [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] Talmud <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִית‎</span> ([[BDB#Dalm|Dalm]]<sup>§ 44, 4</sup>), Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Samaritan <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Mandean <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אית‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עית‎</span> ([[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>M §§ 213. 272</sup>): see further Biblical Hebrew  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יֵשׁ‎</span>); — <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִיתַי‎</span> [[Dan.2.10|Dan 2:10]], suffix <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִיתָיךְ‎</span> [[Dan.2.26|Dan 2:26]] [[BDB#Kt|Kt]] ([[BDB#Qr|Qr]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִיתָךְ‎</span> [[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 53, 2 b</sup>), <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִית֫וֺהִי‎</span> [[Dan.2.11|Dan 2:11]], <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎איתינא‎</span> [[BDB#Kt|Kt]] (i.e. probably <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִיתַ֫יְנָא‎</span>: [[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>l.c.</sup>), [[BDB#Qr|Qr]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִיתָ֫נָא‎</span> [[Dan.3.18|Dan 3:18]], <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִיתֵיכוֺן‎</span> v[[Dan.3.14|Dan 3:14]] v[[Dan.3.15|Dan 3:15]] — ***there is (are)*** . . ., absolute [[Dan.2.28|Dan 2:28]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִיתַי אֱלָהּ בִּשְׁמַיָּא‎</span> ***there is a*** God in heaven, v[[Dan.2.30|Dan 2:30]] not by wisdom <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּיאִֿיתַי בִּי‎</span> that ***is*** in me, [[Dan.3.12|Dan 3:12]]; [[Dan.5.11|Dan 5:11]] followed by participle or adjective [[Dan.2.26|Dan 2:26]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הַאִיתָיךְ כָּהֵל‎</span> ***art*** thou able. . .? [[Dan.3.15|Dan 3:15]]; [[Dan.3.17|Dan 3:17]] followed by <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּי‎</span>, [[Ezra.5.17|Ezra 5:17]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵן אִיתַי דִּי‎</span> if ***it is that***, . . With negative <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לָא אִיתַי‎</span> (so [[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup>D 10</sup> +; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] Syriac, Mandean <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לַיִת‎</span> <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Zenjirli suffix <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לישה‎</span> ([[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>184</sup>); compare below Biblical Hebrew  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יֵשׁ‎</span>) [[Dan.2.10|Dan 2:10]] ... <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לָא אִיתַי אֱנָשׁ כִּי‎</span>, [[Dan.3.29|Dan 3:29]]; [[Dan.4.32|Dan 4:32]] after the subject [[Dan.2.11|Dan 2:11]]a; [[Dan.3.25|Dan 3:25]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בְּהוֺן‎</span> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎וַחֲבָל לָא א‎</span>, [[Ezra.4.16|Ezra 4:16]] followed by participle or adjective [[Dan.3.14|Dan 3:14]]; [[Dan.3.18|Dan 3:18]] with pleonastic suffix, [[Dan.2.11|Dan 2:11]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מְדָֽרְהוֺן‎</span> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עִסבִּֿשְׂרָא לָא אִיתוֺהִי‎</span>.
